page.title: 11POTATOE LIFTING
page.content: Primary land use in the St Saviour area is the growing of potatoes. In the first few months of the year every available piece of land is planted with seed potatoes. 1985 was no exception. Large polythene sheets were placed over the crops to protect them from frost. However, the the large scale use of these sheets also caused problems. Easterly winds blew the potato pest (colorado beetles) from the French mainland. Three live beetles were found on beaches along with many dead ones. If one had managed to get under one of the sheets unnoticed, a colony could have developed. A further problem lay with the humid weather. Damp air and warm temperatures encouraged the development of potato blight.
